H347.def: = man; ◄ from the land of {L:Uz<SDBH:עוּץ>}; ► main character of book of Job

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H575.def: = referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H3013.def: = process by which humans experience sorrow and suffering

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H1792.def: = causative action by which an object is deformed or pulverized by exerting heavy pressure on it

H4405.def: used in poetry only; = a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others

H6471.def: = the lower part of the leg beyond the ankle, on which humans or animals stand and with which they walk

H3637.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H1970.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = action by which humans do not treat other humans well and do not give them the respect they deserve

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H551.def: = marker expressing a speaker's confirmation of the truth of a statement; in some cases the truth of this statement is conceded

H7686.def: = action by which animals move about without apparent purpose or destination

H4879.def: = action by which humans act wrongly, though without the intention to do so

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H551.def: = marker expressing a speaker's confirmation of the truth of a statement; in some cases the truth of this statement is conceded

H1431.def: = process by which objects increase in size

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H3198.def: = action by which someone with judicial authority settles a dispute between two parties

H645.def: = particle linking two propositions, by which Y represents the purpose or result  of X

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5791.def: = process by which something becomes bent or twisted out of shape or position

H5362.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife, razor, or axe to remove part of a larger object

H2555.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans, ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H7768.def: = action by which humans and animals raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H1443.def: = causative action by which someone builds or repairs a wall, often made of natural stones; ≈ such a wall is sometimes used to denote integrity, which can be negatively affected by sin

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H6584.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = process by which a locust sheds its skin

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H5850.def: = circular or semi-circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H5265.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from another object into which it had been inserted or attached in a different way

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H2734.def: = process by which humans gradually disappear from the face of the earth ◄ as if burnt away by fire

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H1416.def: = a group of armed humans equipped for fighting on land, whose main purpose is to execute swift attacks and loot and plunder as much as they can; sometimes also used to denote a unit of a more regular army

H5549.def: literally: to make high; hence: = causative action by which humans create a road or access ramp by covering the surface of the ground with thicks layers of sand

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H2583.def: = state in which an individual or group of people dwells at a certain location for a limited period of time and often for a specific purpose

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H2308.def: = process by which objects stop existing in this world

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H1481.def: = state in which humans live in a place that is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

H519.def: = woman who is the legal property of someone else; either married or eligible for marriage; her children belong to the person who owns her; ≈ because of this an  אָמָה  appears to have a somewhat higher status than a  שִׁפְחָה  even though both terms are sometimes used interchangeably

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H5237.def: = state in which something or someone is identified as different or strange from one's own perspective

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H2603.def: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H2603.def: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H4962.def: = human beings, regardless of sex and age

H5475.def: = a group or gathering of persons (like friends or members of the same group) or heavenly beings

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H2015.def: = action by which humans turn their body around in order to face a different direction than before

H5785.def: = the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a person or animal

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H1692.def: = state in which objects are closely compacted together

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H4422.def: = action by which humans move away as fast as possible from a place that is considered insecure ► in order to save their lives

H2603.def: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5060.def: = process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, whether deliberately or not

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H645.def: = particle linking two propositions, by which Y represents the purpose or result  of X

H4405.def: used in poetry only; = a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others

H3789.def: = action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

H2710.def: = action by which humans reproduce the form or shape of an object on another object; ◄ by carving, drawing, writing, etc.; ► for the purpose of decoration, communication, sometimes as preparation for a new construction

H1270.def: = a strong, hard magnetic silvery-grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence

H5842.def: = reed of about 20 centimeters long and sharpened on one end and split to form a nib; sometimes made of a rush cut at an angle and then frayed to form a fine brush; ► used for making marks with ink on writing material

H5777.def: = a heavy bluish-grey soft metal, ≈ associated with heavy weight

H2672.def: = action by which humans strike an object repeatedly with an axe, chisel, or other sharp implement, ► in order to alter its shape and so create a new object out of it

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H5703.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H314.def: = pertaining to being located behind other objects in a row

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H5785.def: = the thin layer of tissue forming the natural outer covering of the body of a person or animal

H5362.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife, razor, or axe to remove part of a larger object

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H2372.def: = process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H2372.def: = process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3629.def: = either of a pair of relatively small organs in the abdominal cavity of humans and animals; ≈ regarded as a delicacy and usually burned along with the fat of an animal sacrifice on the altar; considered the seat of emotions and one's devotion to God; in its literal sense only used for animals

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H2436.def: = front of the body of a human being, which, when a person is sitting down, forms a kind of platform that can be used for activities like throwing the lot, and that can even function as a sitting place for someone else, like a pet animal, a child or a beloved one; ≈ symbolizes affection and intimacy, and sometimes represents the entire person

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H8328.def: = a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well-being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H1481.def: = state in which humans live in a place that is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
